CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 10, 1965, pg. 17, reads: "Greeting 'The Lion' - Representatives of different generations and different styles were pianist - composer Billy Strayhorn, former Pittsburgher and Duke Ellington's alter ego, and the legendary Willie (The Lion) Smith, who displayed his mastery of traditional jazz at a Sunday afternoon piano workshop, during the recent Jazz Festival in Pittsburgh. 'The Lion's' wife, Mrs. Jane Smith, looks on. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Billy Strayhorn shaking hands with Willie "The Lion" Smith, with Janie Smith on right, during Pittsburgh Jazz Festival jazz workshop, Civic Arena
